name: Cannibal Johnson
affiliation: Enclave Department of the Army(formerly)Enclave remnants
detailed_location: Cannibal Johnson's caveRecruit the remnants:Remnants bunker

topics.response_text: You better get moving kid, there's bad guys to kill.{Bark during Hoover dam battle.}
What do you want to know?
{grinning and being difficult}Ha. I'm not saying. It's part of my mystique, after all.

topics.topic_text: I don't have any more questions. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Well, ain't like I've got places to be.
Be seeing you.{beat, afterthought - he's very old and could die any time}Maybe.

topics.topic_text: What did you do when you were with the Enclave?
topics.response_text: Squad marksman. I'm pretty proud of the fact that I never killed a single soul who wasn't trying to kill me or one of my team first.

topics.topic_text: You live out here by yourself?
topics.response_text: Sure do. Had a wife for awhile - tribal girl, really pretty eyes - but she's been gone a long time now.

topics.topic_text: Arcade asked me to gather all the remaining members of the Enclave in the Mojave.
topics.response_text: {Arcade hired}Thought I recognized the fellow with you. So, what's this reunion all about, then?

topics.topic_text: He thinks your experience and technology will help resolve the conflict in this region.
topics.response_text: Well, now, there's an interesting idea - do a bit of good before we're all dead and forgotten. You can count me in.

topics.topic_text: I'm gathering allies - just in case.
topics.response_text: Yeah, the NCR and the Legion are about due for another dustup. So, you're going to get yourself involved in that? All right, I'm in. Could be fun.

topics.topic_text: Why, do you have something better to do?
topics.response_text: {slightly offended}Hey, I was just asking. No need to get uppity about it. I'll be at the reunion, don't you worry.

topics.topic_text: You make it sound like avoiding innocent deaths was uncommon in the Enclave.
topics.response_text: I'm sorry to say that it was. Civilian casualties was acceptable and sometimes... encouraged. My former squadmate Moreno didn't need encouraging.
I've been in the Reaper's shadow for a long time now, and I thought he'd finally showed up to collect. He's just mocking me now.

topics.topic_text: How much money do you owe this Reaper guy?
topics.response_text: What? I was talking about Death, kid. Guess that one went right over your head, didn't it? Old Sergeant{DOOR-nan}Dornan would've had a field day with you.

topics.topic_text: You sound like you're eager to die.
topics.response_text: There's a twitch in my trigger finger, I've lost my eagle eyes, and the other day I could've sworn I heard Sergeant{DOOR-nan}Dornan chewing me out.
He was a drill instructor I knew. He was also the meanest bastard I've ever known.
Err... yeah. It was a long time ago. Things were better back then.

topics.topic_text: It sounds like there's an interesting story behind it.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] The truth of it is that I did cut out a raider's heart, but only took a bite to mess with his buddies.

conversation.response_text: Be seeing you.{beat, afterthought - he's very old and could die any time}Maybe.
You guys are actually going to help the Legion? No thanks - count me out of this one.

description:
Cannibal Johnson is a 75 year-old Caucasian Male.

A former Enclave soldier living as a hermit, wearing Remnants power armor. He's a skilled marksman who's rumored to have cannibalistic tendencies. Despite his isolated lifestyle, he maintains a sense of loyalty to his former squad.

Cannibal Johnson's Personality: Johnson is a man of few words, with a gruff exterior that masks a sense of duty and loyalty. He's deeply conflicted about his Enclave past but remains fiercely protective of those he considers his family. While he prefers solitude, he's not entirely without compassion, especially toward those who remind him of the people he's lost.

Cannibal Johnson's Backstory: Johnson served as a marksman in the Enclave during their peak power on the West Coast. After the death of his squad leader, Gannon Senior, he and his remaining band of Enclave remnants helped support Gannon's widow and son, Arcade. Despite the Enclave's collapse following the destruction of their oil rig in 2242, Johnson and his squad managed to escape Navarro ahead of the NCR's assault. However, they became targets for both NCR Rangers and the Brotherhood of Steel, forcing them to flee south through the Core Region. After years of keeping a low profile under the NCR's radar, they eventually settled in the Mojave Wasteland, establishing themselves in an old vertibird refueling station before Johnson moved to his current cave home. He's lived in solitude for many years, though he occasionally fondly recalls memories of his past, including his time with his drill instructor, Arch Dornan.
